Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 86 off 63 balls, including six sixes
Shaheen Afridi took 2 wickets for 36 runs
Pakistan collapsed from 155-2 to 191 all out in 12 overs
India chased down the target of 192 with 117 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: Waqar Younis suggested that Pakistan might have to wait another year or two to get their first World Cup win over India
Matthew Henry mentioned that Pakistan's coach, Mickey Arthur, tried to remain upbeat after the loss
Deep Dasgupta pointed out that Shaheen Afridi is not 100% fit and lacks his usual pace
Post-Match Reflections: India captain Rohit Sharma praised his bowlers for setting up the game
Pakistan captain Babar Azam admitted that the team was not up to the mark with the new ball
Waqar Younis stated that Pakistan are at the bottom of the sides aiming for the semi-finals
Jonathan Agnew noted that the game was difficult for Pakistan with all Indian supporters present
Carlos Brathwaite predicted that India are the team to beat at home in this World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: India won with 117 balls remaining, not their biggest victory in terms of balls left in ODIs
Fireworks lit up the night sky in Ahmedabad after the match
